content: Just wondered if anybody has implemented a RMA (return goods) type system (or similar) in Backdrop? We looking for a system for clients to log a return/repair which they post to us, and we update them via email. Eventually I'd like to get our support tickets on the same system.
@Kevin Golding I need to do the same at some point. I was just going to create a webform for someone to fill out so maybe that would be a good solution temporarily.

@Phil Ward That seems like a good starting point, but I do want it to be more than just a form, so I'm trying to decide whether to custom code it in my languages of choice (golang/vuejs) or have a go using backdrop - I suppose I'm just not familiar enough with backdrop to know if it's a reasonable fit.

@Kevin Golding I can't help with the coding side of things but I guess my question is whether you are already using a backdrop site for other items (ecommerce) that would make sense to tie the RMA to a product that already lives on Backdrop.

I'll say that "yes" it can totally be done in Backdrop it's just a matter of whether you would want to code for it. The main benefit to using Backdrop is the field/database structure that Backdrop can provide.

If you think you'll use the site for more than just RMA then yes it's worth it. If you only plan to use the site for RMA then a more straight forward solution might be the better route.

Interesting: https://www.drupal.org/node/1044784
